alert.note: Alert for DeSoto; Marshall (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 18 at 5:56PM CDT until July 18 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern DeSoto County in northwestern Mississippi... Northwestern Marshall County in northwestern Mississippi... Southwestern Fayette County in west Tennessee... Southeastern Shelby County in west Tennessee... * Until 645 PM CDT. * At 556 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Bartlett, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Bartlett, Collierville, Germantown, Olive Branch, Holly Springs, Cordova, Memphis, Lakeland, Byhalia, Mt Pleasant, Ellendale, Southeast Memphis, Red Banks, Slayden, Midtown Memphis, Marianna, Piperton, Rossville, Coal Oil Corner and Lenow. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
